metadata.title: CVE-2023-6228 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was found in the tiffcp utility distributed by the libtiff packagewhere a crafted TIFF file on processing may cause a heap-based bufferoverflow leads to an application crash.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-6228` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm12
libtiff-tools - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm12
libtiff5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm12
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm12
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tiff package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm12').
libtk-img: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
